an5.98:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant practicing mindfulness of breathing who has five things will soon penetrate the unshakable.
an5.98:1.3: It’s when a mendicant has few requirements and duties, and is unburdensome and contented with life’s necessities.
an5.98:1.4: They eat little, not devoted to filling their stomach.
an5.98:1.5: They are rarely drowsy, and are dedicated to wakefulness.
an5.98:1.6: They live in the wilderness, in remote lodgings.
an5.98:1.7: They review the extent of their mind’s freedom.
an5.98:1.8: A mendicant practicing mindfulness of breathing who has these five things will soon penetrate the unshakable.”
